episodeTitle: Warden Magellan's Strategy! Straw Hat Entrapment Completed!
description: Magellan learns of Luffy's infiltration and orders all forces to Level 4 to trap the intruders. Bentham reveals his desire to meet Emporio Ivankov on Level 5. Meanwhile, Luffy, Bentham, Buggy, and Galdino face the fearsome Minotaurus and must work together to defeat the powerful Jailer Beast.

events.title: Bentham's Real Name Confirmed
events.description: The Impel Down staff identify Mr. 2 Bon Clay's real name as Bentham as they track the intruders through the prison.
events.significance: Official confirmation of Bentham's given name in the anime, though this had been mentioned previously in the series.

events.title: Galdino's Real Name Confirmed
events.description: The Impel Down staff identify Mr. 3's real name as Galdino while tracking the escaped prisoners.
events.significance: Official confirmation of Galdino's given name in the anime adaptation.

events.title: Hancock Departs Impel Down
events.description: Boa Hancock and Vice Admiral Momonga return to the prison's surface after Hancock's visit to Ace. Domino unlocks Hancock's Sea Prism Stone handcuffs and returns her fur cape, thanking her for her cooperation.
events.significance: Hancock successfully completes her mission of smuggling Luffy into Impel Down disguised as helping him infiltrate. She maintains her cover while secretly hoping Luffy can rescue Ace.

quotes.text: Anyone who'd break into this prison must be crazy.
quotes.speaker: Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock pretends to be unaware of Luffy's infiltration while secretly worrying about him

events.title: First Mention of Emporio Ivankov in Impel Down
events.description: Bentham reveals to Luffy that he wants to meet Emporio Ivankov, the Queen of Kamabakka Kingdom, who is imprisoned on Level 5 of Impel Down. Bentham describes Ivankov as the 'miracle worker' who leads the okama.
events.significance: First time Emporio Ivankov is mentioned in the Impel Down arc, setting up their eventual meeting on Level 5.5 and Ivankov's crucial role in saving Luffy's life and helping with the prison break.

quotes.text: I want to meet a certain someone. The Queen of Kamabakka Kingdom, the pink paradise of the Grand Line. That person is Ivan, the miracle worker!
quotes.speaker: Bentham
quotes.context: Bentham explains his motivation for going deeper into Impel Down

events.title: Kamabakka Kingdom First Mentioned
events.description: Bentham describes Kamabakka Kingdom as the 'pink paradise of the Grand Line' when explaining who Emporio Ivankov is.
events.significance: First mention of Kamabakka Kingdom in the anime, which will later become the location where Sanji trains during the two-year timeskip.

events.title: Magellan Orders Forces to Level 4
events.description: Chief Warden Magellan finally receives word of Luffy's break-in and the chaos on Level 3. He orders all forces to mobilize to Level 4, the Burning Heat Hell, to cut off Luffy and his allies, declaring he will kill them all himself if Minotaurus fails.
events.significance: Magellan's strategic decision to trap the intruders on Level 4 demonstrates his tactical prowess and sets up the inevitable confrontation between Luffy and the prison's most dangerous warden.

quotes.text: With too many places to hide on Level 3, we'll deploy all groups to Level 4. When the prisoners arrive, I'll kill them all myself should Minotaurus fail.
quotes.speaker: Magellan
quotes.context: Magellan formulating his strategy to trap and eliminate the intruders

events.title: Saldeath's Failure Reported
events.description: Magellan demands to know what happened to Saldeath, who was supposed to be handling the escapees on Level 3. The staff reports that the Blugori were ineffective and had to be moved back to Level 2 to quell a prisoner riot started by Buggy.
events.significance: Shows the extent of the chaos caused by Luffy's infiltration and Buggy's antics, demonstrating how the prison's security is being overwhelmed.

events.title: Ace Begs Luffy Not to Come
events.description: Deep within Level 6 of Impel Down, Portgas D. Ace overhears the announcement about forces gathering on Level 4 to stop the intruders. Realizing his brother Luffy is coming to rescue him, Ace desperately begs Luffy not to come, not wanting him to risk his life.
events.significance: Demonstrates Ace's love for his brother and his guilt over causing Luffy to put himself in such danger. This emotional moment highlights the bond between the brothers and Ace's selflessness.

quotes.text: Luffy... don't come. Please, don't come for me!
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace's desperate plea upon realizing Luffy is infiltrating Impel Down to save him

events.title: Luffy and Bentham Reach the Pit to Level 4
events.description: Luffy and Bentham arrive at a massive pit leading down to Level 4, the Burning Heat Hell. They can see the scorching heat rising from below, resembling a boiling pot.
events.significance: Marks the transition point as Luffy progresses deeper into Impel Down toward Ace, bringing him closer to the most dangerous levels of the prison.

events.title: Minotaurus Debuts
events.description: Minotaurus, the first Jailer Beast to appear in the series, confronts Luffy and Bentham. The massive creature resembles a muscular humanoid cow carrying a large spiked club, demonstrating incredible speed and power.
events.significance: Introduces the Jailer Beasts, powerful awakened Zoan users who guard Impel Down. This is the first appearance of an awakened Devil Fruit user in the series, though it's not explicitly revealed until later.

events.title: First Battle with Minotaurus
events.description: Minotaurus attacks Luffy and Bentham with tremendous force, swinging his massive club at high speeds. The beast manages to land several hits on both fighters, demonstrating his overwhelming power.
events.significance: Shows that even after all of Luffy's growth, the guardians of Impel Down are formidable opponents requiring strategy and teamwork to defeat.

events.title: Luffy Uses Gomu Gomu no Jet Bazooka
events.description: Luffy activates Gear Second and counters Minotaurus with a Gomu Gomu no Jet Bazooka, a powerful double-palm strike that sends the beast flying up the stairs.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's Gear Second abilities, though even this powerful attack isn't enough to fully defeat Minotaurus, showcasing the Jailer Beast's incredible durability.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy using Gear Second to counter Minotaurus's attack

events.title: Unlikely Allies Reunite
events.description: Luffy and Bentham encounter Buggy and Galdino again as they are all being chased by Minotaurus. Despite their previous antagonism, the four realize they must work together to survive.
events.significance: Establishes the temporary alliance between former enemies, showing that desperate circumstances can create unlikely partnerships. This teamwork will be crucial for their survival in Impel Down.

events.title: Bentham's Memoir of a Winter's Sky
events.description: Bentham attacks Minotaurus with his powerful kick technique called 'Memoir of a Winter's Sky' (Fuyu no Sora no Tsuioku), striking the beast with tremendous force as part of the group's coordinated assault.
events.significance: Showcases Bentham's martial arts abilities and his willingness to fight alongside Luffy despite the overwhelming odds.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Tonkachi Rifle - Combined Attack
events.description: In a desperate combination attack, Galdino coats Luffy's arm with his hardened wax while Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Rifle. The wax acts like a massive mallet, creating the 'Gomu Gomu no Tonkachi Rifle' (Gum-Gum Mallet Rifle) that finally defeats Minotaurus.
events.significance: First demonstration of Luffy combining his abilities with another Devil Fruit user's powers to create a more powerful attack. This shows Luffy's adaptability and willingness to work with others, even former enemies.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy combining his attack with Galdino's wax to create a powerful finishing move

events.title: Minotaurus Defeated Through Teamwork
events.description: Through the combined efforts of Luffy, Bentham, Buggy, and Galdino, the seemingly unstoppable Minotaurus is finally knocked down. The four unlikely allies prove that even powerful foes can be overcome through cooperation.
events.significance: Demonstrates the power of teamwork and marks the first time former Baroque Works agents and Luffy work together effectively. Also shows that the Jailer Beasts, while powerful, can be defeated with strategy and coordination.

quotes.text: I want to meet a certain someone. The Queen of Kamabakka Kingdom, the pink paradise of the Grand Line. That person is Ivan, the miracle worker!
quotes.speaker: Bentham
quotes.context: Bentham reveals his motivation for descending deeper into Impel Down

quotes.text: With too many places to hide on Level 3, we'll deploy all groups to Level 4. When the prisoners arrive, I'll kill them all myself should Minotaurus fail.
quotes.speaker: Magellan
quotes.context: Magellan strategizing to trap the intruders

quotes.text: Luffy... don't come. Please, don't come for me!
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace's desperate plea upon realizing Luffy is trying to rescue him

quotes.text: Anyone who'd break into this prison must be crazy.
quotes.speaker: Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock maintaining her cover while secretly worrying about Luffy

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's combined attack with Galdino's wax to defeat Minotaurus

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how former enemies must work together to survive. Luffy, Bentham, Buggy, and Galdino - characters who previously fought against each other - combine their abilities to defeat Minotaurus.
themes.symbolism: The combined attack (Gomu Gomu no Tonkachi Rifle) symbolizes how cooperation can overcome seemingly insurmountable obstacles.

themes.description: Ace's desperate plea for Luffy not to come demonstrates his love for his brother and his willingness to sacrifice himself rather than see Luffy endangered.
themes.symbolism: Ace's isolation in Level 6 contrasts with Luffy's growing group of allies, highlighting the different paths the brothers have taken.

themes.description: As Luffy descends deeper into Impel Down, the threats become more formidable. The introduction of Minotaurus and Magellan's strategic response show that the challenges are intensifying.
themes.symbolism: The descent through the levels of Impel Down mirrors a journey into hell, with each level more dangerous than the last.
culturalReferences: The structure of Impel Down parallels Dante's Inferno, with each descending level representing greater punishment and danger

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his adaptability by working with former enemies and combining his abilities with Galdino's wax powers. His determination to save Ace drives him forward despite the escalating dangers.
keyActions: Progresses deeper into Impel Down toward Level 4
Uses Gomu Gomu no Jet Bazooka against Minotaurus
Creates combination attack with Galdino to defeat Minotaurus
Learns about Emporio Ivankov from Bentham

characterSpotlights.development: Bentham reveals his personal mission to meet Emporio Ivankov, adding depth to his character beyond just helping Luffy. His fighting prowess and loyalty are on full display.
keyActions: Reveals desire to meet Emporio Ivankov
Mentions Kamabakka Kingdom for the first time
Uses Memoir of a Winter's Sky technique
quotes: I want to meet a certain someone. The Queen of Kamabakka Kingdom, the pink paradise of the Grand Line. That person is Ivan, the miracle worker!

characterSpotlights.development: Magellan is portrayed as a strategic and dangerous opponent who takes personal command of stopping the intruders. His decision to position forces on Level 4 shows tactical thinking.
keyActions: Declares he will personally eliminate the intruders
Demonstrates strategic command of Impel Down
quotes: With too many places to hide on Level 3, we'll deploy all groups to Level 4. When the prisoners arrive, I'll kill them all myself should Minotaurus fail.

characterSpotlights.development: Ace's emotional response to learning Luffy is coming shows his deep love for his brother and his guilt over being the cause of Luffy's dangerous mission.
keyActions: Realizes Luffy is coming to rescue him
Desperately begs Luffy not to come
quotes: Luffy... don't come. Please, don't come for me!

characterSpotlights.development: Minotaurus debuts as a fearsome guardian of Impel Down, demonstrating the power of the Jailer Beasts and awakened Zoan abilities.
keyActions: Makes first appearance in the series
Attacks Luffy and Bentham with overwhelming force
Pursues all four escapees through Level 3

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded the fight with Minotaurus with additional action sequences and showcased the combination attack more dramatically than the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode corresponds to Chapter 532 of the manga, titled 'Jailer Beast Minotaurus'.
Minotaurus is the first awakened Devil Fruit user to appear in the One Piece anime, though this is not revealed until Episode 447 when Crocodile explains what the Jailer Beasts are.
The opening theme 'Kaze wo Sagashite' by Mari Yaguchi and Straw Hat was used for episodes 426-458, covering most of the Impel Down arc.
This is the first mention of Kamabakka Kingdom in the anime, which later becomes the location where Sanji trains during the two-year timeskip.
The Gomu Gomu no Tonkachi Rifle is the first combination attack between Luffy and another Devil Fruit user shown in the series.
Level 4 of Impel Down is heated by a massive pool of boiling blood, which is why it's called the 'Burning Heat Hell' or 'Blazing Hell'.
In SBS Volume 111, Oda revealed that the Jailer Beasts are failed awakened Zoans who lost their humanity to their Devil Fruit powers.
